info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, southwestern Polk and northeastern Greenville Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 718 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Hendersonville, or near Saluda, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saluda, Tigerville, Flat Rock, Gowensville, Tuxedo, North Saluda Reservoir, Glassy Mountain and East Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
